snippet: General Motors said it would focus new attention on its struggling Opel brand in Europe after net income in the second quarter fell to $1.48 billion, from $2.52 billion in the same period a year ago.
abstract: General Motors says it will focus new attention on its struggling Opel brand in Europe after net income in the second quarter falls 41 percent to $1.48 billion, from $2.52 billion in the year-ago quarter; revenue drops to $37.6 billion from $39.4 billion.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic reported from Detroit and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: General Motors said it would focus new attention on its struggling Opel brand in Europe after net income in the second quarter fell to $1.48 billion, from $2.52 billion in the same period a year ago.

headline.seo: G.M.’s Profit Falls 41% on Losses in Europe
headline.main: After a Loss in Europe, G.M. Plans Fast Action
headline.print_headline: After a Loss, G.M. Plans Fast Action In Europe
